meanings.definition: A person who has charge of something
meanings.sent1: The custos of the library ensures all books are returned on time.
meanings.sent2: The custos of the museum carefully watches over the valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The custos of the park chased after a mischievous squirrel causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: She was the custos of the family heirlooms, protecting them with her life.
meanings.sent5: The custos of the keys jingled as he walked down the hallway.

meanings.sent1: The custos of the castle defended it from invaders.
meanings.sent2: As a custos of the forest, he ensured all creatures were safe.
meanings.sent3: The custos of the cookies made sure no one stole a bite.
meanings.sent4: She was the custos of his heart, keeping it safe from harm.
meanings.sent5: The custos of the treasure chest kept a watchful eye on it at all times.

meanings.sent1: The custos of the lighthouse maintained the beacon for ships.
meanings.sent2: The custos of the garden tended to the flowers with care.
meanings.sent3: The custos of the lost and found organized items by category.
meanings.sent4: She was the custos of the family recipes, preserving them for generations.
meanings.sent5: The custos of the secret passage kept it hidden from prying eyes.
